params.merchantId: The unique identifier for the merchant (bytes32)
params.paymentTokenAddress: The ERC20 token address for payments

returns.escrowAddress: The address of the deployed escrow contract

returns.exists: True if merchant has deployed escrows

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.paymentTokenAddress: The ERC20 token address for payments

returns.predictedAddress: The predicted address of the next escrow contract

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

deployEscrow(bytes32,address,address).notice: Deploy a new escrow contract for a merchant

getEscrowsForMerchant(bytes32).notice: Get all escrow addresses for a merchant

getMerchantCounter(bytes32).notice: Get the current counter for a merchant

getMerchantEscrowCount(bytes32).notice: Get the number of escrows deployed for a merchant

getMerchantForEscrow(address).notice: Get the merchant ID for an escrow contract

merchantExists(bytes32).notice: Check if a merchant has any deployed escrows

predictEscrowAddress(bytes32,address,add.notice: Predict the address of the next escrow contract for a merchant

setDefaultOwner(address).notice: Update the default owner for new escrow contracts

documentation.text:
@notice Update the platform address
 @param _platformAddress New platform address

@notice Update the default owner for new escrow contracts
 @param _defaultOwner New default owner address
